comment.body: @Jayofthezero: If a popular project is source closed, not everyone can modify it, but still many hackers can (crack it and) inject malware to it. Who can you trust? What can you trust? :)

Decentralized library topic on Reddit, it may be the best memorial for Aaron Swartz.

@ZAlex: @Kaffie: Remind me of a case: [WhatsApp donates 1 Million Dollars to the FreeBSD Foundation](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=8620716), if you are poor and want to be rich for yourself, as long as you create great product and it's not easy to be copied by others. BSD probably a better system and license you need, if you want more people benefit and to contribute for a better world, GPL will be a better choice, but you probably won't be very competitive in the business world.
Also values and rules of competition can change.
@ZAlex: linux foundation is hated by quite some community devs afaik [Linux Foundation quietly drops community representation](https://mjg59.dreamwidth.org/39546.html) It's GNU/Linux.
@ZAlex: It's supported by many big companies, therefore they may want to change Linux license to others very much. But yes, it's quite rich now.
If I understand correctly, every site is in a sandbox, authorization is controlled by ZeroFrame API, as long as there isn't a severe bug in ZeroNet, it should be impossible.

```
#!/bin/sh

ZERO_DIR=~/ZeroNet-master
ZERO_HOST=127.0.0.1

NEW_SITES=`sqlite3 $ZERO_DIR/content.db "select address from site;"`
for SITE in $NEW_SITES; do
    echo Check site $SITE
    curl --header "Accept: text/html" --silent http://$ZERO_HOST:43110/$SITE > /dev/null
done
```
You can try this script, you need to copy the old data/content.db to root directory of ZeroNet of your new device. Idea from [New ZeroNet Sites](/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/)

@Musickiller: `data/content.db` is /path/to/zeronet/data/content.db, which also has site list like sites.json. In the script curl can trigger add all sites from site list. You can try to copy content.json-s, I don't know if it works.

@Musickiller: Command for using sites.json instead: 
```
NEW_SITES=`python -c "import json; print('\n'.join(json.load(open('sites.json'))));"`
```
Guess it has something to do with "not be found or loaded correctly", some videos can take more than 5 min to load. Big file support is coming, the experience will be a lot better then.
Probably you have some good peers in your device, for me 5 min later it's still not loaded ;_;

@Musickiller: Can you load the [lyric image](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?route:item+id:1_1G27nKed7YQPtNxhH7DXoEKkmjj7Yq5D1x_19+type:image)? If you also can't, you need to manually check file and update [IFS Cluster 1](/15fDN4wasXuyS8krtKvrxEVmWWLz6Qh518/). If you can, I don't know why
It won't work in the Zerovoat Clone, also official Zerovoat is normal now, you may need to rebuild the database or delete/re-add the site to make it totally functional

In my case ABE function of Noscript add-on is not compatible with the newest Icecat, I can't open ZeroNet or router config panel with it, my solution is by searching "ABE" in about:config, change `extension.nsa.ABE.enabled` to false, then restart Icecat, everything works again.
So you can try to disable/update some of the add-ons, or [debug the problem](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Remote_Debugging/Debugging_Firefox_for_Android_over_Wifi)

@Musickiller: My pleasure :D Also you can request feature or submit issue to [its github repository](https://github.com/zer0net/zerovoat), IFS is also [under the same account](https://github.com/zer0net/ifs-master)

You can disable fullscreen mode in Setting -> Display. It's a bug from Lightning browser, in fullscreen mode the display is not of 100% height when with the address bar, so you may file the bug to the wrong place :P
Have a good sleep and enjoy the next day :)

JPG is auto-converted by 0-gallery, but the convert should be lossless. Those noises are caused by the limitation of the software and/or my Android tablet.

@Musickiller: The major ZeroNet node I'm using is on an ALARM, Raspi2, so it's 24h online, sometimes overloaded though. Also attached with an external HDD.

@空澄砂夜: Thx for the correction. I do an experiment with convert command and set the quality to 100, the result is really funny XD

@Musickiller: 
> now it gives me a kernel panic after even right after I flash a fresh OS there

That's awful, I think you're not the only one have this problem, so search engine and forums will be your good friends.
> is ALARM configured the way Arch is, or the way Raspbian is?

No editing config on boot. Also I've backup the whole system using `cp --archive --one-file-system` after config a fresh system, so if my ALARM is dead, I can easily create a new one without configuing anything, easier than installing raspbian ;)

@Musickiller: No ALARM specific, here is the full recipe
```
##backup and restore system, can avoid proc, sys
shell# cp --archive --one-file-system /home <DESTINATION>
shell# cp --archive --one-file-system / <DESTINATION>

##For restoration
shell# cp --archive <ROOT_BACKUP>/* /
shell# cp --archive <HOME_BACKUP>/* /home 
 
## For raspberry pi
restore by mounting the boot partition without root (from filemanager)
```
@空澄砂夜: That's thorough! Sasuga Senpai :3
@Musickiller: Yup, typo. Yes if your home folder is in the same partition of root system, so yes for ALARM

Yup, sometimes I felt you could find the answer easily by yourself so I didn't reply to your question. But it's really nice to have you here :) Since most people here are mute nerds (I'm also not a chatty type). I believe many fellows here feel the same

In my Iridium (libre version of chromium) the cursor in the url bar is in the middle though, wonder if it has something to do with font size, also I have hard time to keep font vertically central when creating css style, in different browser it can be totally in different position...

@Musickiller: It's in the [fsf software directory](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/Iridium)
> Iridium is a free, and libre browser modification of the Chromium code base, with privacy being enhanced in several key areas. Automatic transmission of partial queries, keywords, metrics to central services inhibited and only occurs with consent. In addition, all our builds are reproducible, and modifications are auditable, setting the project ahead of other secure browser providers.
Yup, I can
Congrats :D
